course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Switch Mode Power Converters
course.description: DC-DC conversion: topologies, continuous and discontinuous conduction modes, steady state analysis, loop gain analysis and relevant mathematical tools, stability and compensation; AC-DC conversion: power factor correctors.

reviews.author: Raccoon
reviews.comment_content:
This course provides basic knowledge about switch mode power converter. It puts a focus on the control theory in the converter design.

Personally, I think this course is more like introducing the control theory on the background of electronic circuit. It can be quite useful if one is a new guy in the electronic engineering.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is conducted by step-by-step mathematics derivation. It may be a little bit boring though.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good. There are midterm and final, but the questions are mostly variants of the homework questions, and one can get through them easily if he/she finishes the homework with enough thoughts. The amount of questions in the exams may be a little bit high and one can not finish all of them, but the professor will curve the grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 5~6 assignments. There are intensive calculations and light logical deductions. Finishing each of them may take 1 day time. If you enjoy the calculation, this is fine. But if you find calculation very tedious, it can be quite a nightmare.
